name: SurgeryRespiratorySystemAccessorySinuses
title: Surgery Respiratory System  Accessory Sinuses
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains CPT codes associated with Surgery Respiratory System  Accessory Sinuses.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients with Surgery Respiratory System  Accessory Sinuses.),(Inclusion Criteria: CPT codes associated with Surgery Respiratory System  Accessory Sinuses are included in this value set.),(Exclusion Criteria: Codes not associated with Surgery Respiratory System  Accessory Sinuses are excluded from this value set. Codes captured in systems other than CPT are also excluded from the value set.)

concept.display: Nasal endoscopy, diagnostic, unilateral or bilateral (separate procedure)
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, diagnostic; with maxillary sinusoscopy (via inferior meatus or canine fossa puncture)
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, diagnostic; with sphenoid sinusoscopy (via puncture of sphenoidal face or cannulation of ostium)
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical; with biopsy, polypectomy or debridement (separate procedure)
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical; with control of nasal hemorrhage
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical; with concha bullosa resection
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical, with maxillary antrostomy; with removal of tissue from maxillary sinus
Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical, with frontal sinus exploration, including removal of tissue from frontal sinus, when performed
